subject: Gardening
title: Kirstenbosch: Africa's Botanical Jewel
description: A micro-lesson that makes Kirstenbosch: Africa's Botanical Jewel usable.

hook.text: Kirstenbosch in Cape Town is the only botanical garden in the world planted within a UNESCO Natural Heritage Site.

buildup.text: Founded in 1913, it was one of the first gardens dedicated exclusively to indigenous flora of a region.

discovery.text: The Cape Floristic Region it showcases has 9,000 plant speciesâ€”more per square kilometer than the Amazon.

twist.text: Cecil Rhodes once owned the land. Post-apartheid South Africa reframed Kirstenbosch as a symbol of natural heritage.

climax.text: Kirstenbosch celebrates biodiversity you can find nowhere elseâ€”a garden that is also a conservation argument.

punchline.text: Africa's greatest garden grows plants found nowhere else.

quiz.question: What makes Kirstenbosch unique among the world's botanical gardens?
options: It's the only botanical garden within a UNESCO Natural Heritage Site
It has the largest greenhouse in the Southern Hemisphere
It was the first garden to use solar-powered irrigation
